title: Don't shit talk people's builds
body:
So i'm making this post after a game i had where i had an ADC abusing my top laner for building a Maw as a defensive item.

1. If you don't consistently watch Pro streams, don't use "pro's don't build this" as a reason for anything
2. If you don't actually read patch notes, and look at the changes don't criticize anyone's build.
3. It's the pre-season, things have been changed, assume you missed a change and whatever they are building is hidden OP cause it's very likely it is, first patch for guinsoo's people only realized after a week that it was broken (i built it like once in the first few days on Kog and got criticized for building it)

replies.body:

I've had so many people call me names and abuse me for building "Frost Queen's Claim" on my mid lane champions ({{champion:103}} , {{champion:99}}, {{champion:134}} and {{champion:4}} mostly), simply because they don't understand or know the power and value of it (before it's nerfed). As soon as it starts I just mute them now, you can still see their pings in game for teamfights if they have anything positive to contribute.
Ironically, i only got this once, before people actually caught on.

Just like in general don;t shit talk anyone ... If they are building something weird but its working then thats all good! if they have some weird stuff in their build and they aren't doing all that great, friendly suggest a better item because they might actually have never played that champ before and are open to tips. And really unless its ranked ... let people do whatever they want... its just a game after all, you should be playing for fun and not for a win. It is fun to win but it is also fun to just play the game. So why are you still building BotRK?

Why are you using RFC instead of stattik shiv?

And why do you always take Mortal Reminder in games where there isn't any hard healing?

See all of this is the sort of shit i see in games, and there is only 2 that are legitmate (Cull/Mortal reminder)

Cull is fucking amazing, despite what the pros say.
The stats it gives you are hardly that different from D Blade, and for something that costs the same as D Blade it ends up being cheaper with it's return actually being profitable.
Certain abilities like Ezreal/MF Q will proc the heal of Cull but not the minute lifesteal of D Blade, in the case of Miss Fortune's Double Up Cull's heal is procced twice.
D Blade hasn't been good since they gave it lifesteal again, since at the same time they nerfed lifesteal in runes, if Lifesteal Quints stayed the same as they were before taking D Blade now would be quite decent if you want in lane sustain, but as it currently stands it's not worth until you actually start doing damage in a single auto attack for you to maintain your sustain.
If you're good at CS, there really isn't a reason to get D Blade over Cull, especially on champs that easily proc Cull's sustain and CS like MF and Ezreal.

Why take Mortal Reminder?
Why not take Mortal Reminder?
Out of it and Lord Dominik's Regards, Mortal Reminder is just better.
Grievous Wounds will help you out trade the enemy ADC by letting you heal back more health than they can.
It's especially strong right now considering that {{summoner:7}} was nerfed and no longer cleanses Grievous Wounds.
Add on top of that, that BotRK is far more effective at dealing with tanks than the shitty health based passive on Lord Dominik's Regards.
Out right armour pen has been hit pretty hard this preseason, despite the overall buff to ADCs.
Ghostblade is no longer an effective item for Marksmen to buy, but is still decent for Assassins.
So it really comes down to Mortal Reminder or Lord Dominik's Regards, and LDR just sucks. It will give you a minor power buff against Brawlers and Tanks, yet not help against Assassins or other ADCs, where Mortal Reminder will let you out trade other ADCs and give Assassins what for if they take a risky dive attempt.
Not to mention long range sustained poke combined with Grievous Wounds will whittle away the enemy nicely, or hell a Miss Fortune ult with Mortal Reminder shreds for days.

Rapidfire Cannon is stupid.
It's far too strong at this point, it needs to be toned down.
Perhaps in a similar fashion as they did with Tenacity. So that the longer your base range is, the less RFC gives you for it's charged shot.
A lot of people get both Shiv and RFC, but next patch that wont be happening since only one of their passives will be allowed. (Just like how mid lanners wont be getting Frost Queen's anymore next patch ;D )
I should probably get Shiv on MF, but I just enjoy the 8% Movespeed too much on RFC as well as the ability to just get that final Love Tap from extended range.
RFC pretty much let's Ezreal fire his AA at the same range as his Q, and again I love the 8% movespeed too much to care about a slight increase to wave clear. Also RFC's bonus damage on hit is applied with Ezreal and MF's Qs, especially nice on Ezreal, while Shiv's bonus magic damage can be higher due to being able to crit abilities that apply on hit effects can't crit so the higher base damage of RFC is better for that.
pretty sure 5% of 120 damage is higher than 3.

>Cull is fucking amazing, despite what the pros say.

Hint: Generally the things pros say are backed up by stats.

>The stats it gives you are hardly that different from D Blade, and for something that costs the same as D Blade it ends up being cheaper with it's return actually being profitable.

So first the stat difference.

- 3 AD
- 80 Health
- Healing after your first back (as you will generally have the LS outclass the on hit health by this point)
+ 400 gold

Now this would all be fine **if starting items were sold when the cull passive is claimed**

Fact is the only reason this would ever outclass doran's blade is in the case where, the starting item will be sold at the 100 CS mark, and honestly, this should only happen in the depths of bronze where farming is about who hits 100 CS by 40 minutes.

Fact is it lacks hard combat stats, and considering the game is early/mid game centric, Doran's blade is superior.

Sure the item pays for itself, but you can pay for the change to doran's blade by killing your opponent with the superior combat stats.

The only reason to get cull is to play passive, and that's not what this season is about.

>Why take Mortal Reminder?
Why not take Mortal Reminder?
Out of it and Lord Dominik's Regards, Mortal Reminder is just better.

Lord Dominik's does better if they have more health.
